definition[0]: peer-to-peer computer systems make it possible to exchange files, software etc between two computers, even though they are not connected to each other
definition[1]: person-to-person methods of paying for something allow the person buying something on the Internet to pay the person who is selling it
definition[2]: involving direct communication between computers, without using a main central server
example[1]: P2P networks are de-centralised, which means that there is no central server that keeps track of all the information in the system.
